ezvcard.io.json

Class JCardWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • ezvcard.io.StreamWriter
      • ezvcard.io.json.JCardWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable

    public class JCardWriter
extends StreamWriter
implements Flushable

    Writes VCard objects to a JSON data stream (jCard format).

    Example: 

     VCard vcard1 = ...
 VCard vcard2 = ...
 File file = new File("vcard.json");
 JCardWriter writer = null;
 try {
   writer = new JCardWriter(file);
   writer.write(vcard1);
   writer.write(vcard2);
 } finally {
   if (writer != null) writer.close();
 }
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt, Buddy Gorven
    See Also:
    RFC 7095

      • setPrettyPrinter

        public void setPrettyPrinter(PrettyPrinter prettyPrinter)
        Sets the pretty printer to pretty-print the JSON with. Note that this method implicitly enables indenting, so setPrettyPrint(true) does not also need to be called.
        Parameters:
        prettyPrinter - the custom pretty printer (defaults to an instance of JCardPrettyPrinter, if setPrettyPrint(true) has been called.
